results.title: Classic Fairy Tales
results.brief_description: Puss in Boots, “The Ugly Duckling”, “Rapunzel”, “The Four Musicians”, “The Emperor’s New Clothes”, and “The Princess and the Pea”. Six of the finest tales from the great fairy story tellers - Hans Christian Anderson, The Brothers Grimm and Charles Perrault. Each story is presented in a new, colourful and lively style but yet retains the best of traditional story telling. The stories are funny, tender, exciting and sometimes a little scary - tales which children will want to see and hear again and again. Rated: G

results.title: Classic Everest
results.brief_description: Looks at a group of ordinary people as they travel part way up Mount Everest. the group is led by tashi tensing, grandson of the famous sherpa who accompanied Hilary on the first successful climb of Everest. Also includes rare footage of the bones claimed to be from the famous Yeti, along with the Mani Rhindu festival at the Tenboche Monastry.

results.title: Classic cars in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jeff Watson Productions and Jeff Watson
results.brief_description: Featured in “My Car” on “The World Tonight” with Clive Robertson. In an age when all cars look the same, this video profiles the cars we would all like to own, or did own. Some of the cars features are the Austin Healy “Bug-Eye” Sprite, Austin 7, Ford Mustang, Jaguar SS, Mercedes-Benz 300SL “Gullwing”, Morris Minor, Volkswagen 1946, plus classic cars from the Repco Mountain Rally.

results.title: Classe Tous Risques = the Big Risk
results.creator_credit: Jean Darvey, Robert Amon, Jacques Plante and Claude Sautet
results.brief_description:
Abel Davos is on the most wanted list in both France and Italy. With the assistance of Naldi, he manages to reunite with Therese, his wife, and their children in the border town of Vintimillle. As they make their way to Menton, the police attempt to arrest them. The operation takes a nasty turn and both Therese and Naldi are killed. Abel and the children go into hiding in Nice where Abel endeavours to re-establish contact with former accomplices and organise a bank robbery.

Credits: Producers, Jean Darvey, Robert Amon, Jacques Plante ; director, Claude Sautet ; writers, Claude Sautet, Pascal Jardin, Jose Giovanni ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Lino Ventura, Jean-Paul Belmondo, Sandra Milo, Jacques Dacqmine, Marcel Dalio, Bernard Dheran, Claude Cerval, Michel Ardan, Rene Genin, Charles Blavette.

results.title: Class project: the garbage movie
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Mark Zannis, Peter Katadotis and Martin Defalco
results.brief_description: A group of pupils, aged 8-13, start off on a school project to find out all they can about garbage, its composition, its disposal and the impact of its disposal on the environment. The places they visit tell us a lot about the society we live in and about ecology, cities, art and history. The students are shown that what we do today has an impact on what happens tomorrow.

results.title: Class of promise
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Kramer, John Spotton and Barbara Sears
results.brief_description: Before 1965, not a single woman had received a Master’s degree in Business Administration from the University of Western Ontario. Two decades later, the class of ‘84 was almost 25% female. Class of Promise tracks the progress of selected students and the careers of several female graduates. Their impact on management in the male-dominated business world is considerable, but ultimately they still find themselves wrestling with issues career-oriented men seldom have to face, particularly the conflict between family and work.

results.title: Class lot
results.brief_description:
Gyorgy Peto, an Hungarian businessman and musician, took a large number of home movies. Like many film hobbyists he chose to record the special days and lighter moments in life; his wife Eva on holidays, a new baby being bathed, daughter Kati at her birthday party, and his nightly job playing viola in the Budapest Metropolitan Operetta. Director Peter Forgacs takes these “private histories”, which date from 1946 through to the 1960s, and creates an evocative family portrait, layering the sequences of affectionate domestic images with footage from other sources that reveals the much harsher “official history” of a Jewish family during the Second World War and the communist era of the fifties.

Woven into the soundtrack is the voice of the adult Kati, who reminisces about her youth and her relationship with her parents. As a child of holocaust survivors, there was much that could not be spoken about. Kati remarks, “I always felt things were somewhere else, not where I was.” The more we learn about the experiences of Gyorgy, Eva and their extended family, the more the transient moments of casual happiness captured by the home movies grow in emotional power. This exploration of memory and history, presence and loss is supported by the music of Tibor Szemzo.

results.title: Clash of the titans
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Charles H. Schneer, Ray Harryhausen and Desmond Davis
results.brief_description: Harry Hamlin stars in this film as Perseus, the Greek mythological character, a gifted impetuous youth, sent on a heroic quest. His mission is to fight the deadly creature Kraken, a towering sea monster that is the last of the powerful Titans. If Perseus succeeds he will win the hand of the beautiful Andromeda, an imprisoned princess, and gain the ownership of half the kingdom. Having embarked on his quest, Perseus is aided by Pegasus, the winged horse and Ammon, a benevolent playwright. Laurence Olivier stars as the God Zeus and Maggie Smith as Thetis, a Greek Goddess with magical powers. Ray Harryhausen (who worked on Jason and the Argonauts) utilised his skills and experience to create stop animation for many sequences, which to modern CGI eyes can seem quite dated. Some impressive cinematography is let down by the clunky dialogue and inexpressive face of lead Harry Hamlin but the film is fun and provides a background to the wonderful world of Greek mythology. Conceived in the wake of the phenomenal success of “Star Wars”, “Clash of the titans” did not reach its expected audience who were flooding instead to the thrills of “Raiders of the lost ark”.

results.title: Clash of the carnivores. Window on the wild
results.brief_description: Clash of the carnivores examines the Tasmanian Devil, Tiger Quoll and Eastern Quoll which once ranged across mainland Australia but are now only found in the rugged regions of Tasmania. The competition for a limited food supply is fierce with some unexpected battles and alliances. Healesville Sanctuary features in “Window on the wild” where studies are being undertaken into the lifestyle of nocturnal animals such as the Eastern-barred bandicoot. The sanctuary provides an ideal study locale in addition to a refuge for these highly endangered species.
